columns.text: This task aims to determine the range of lease payments that make the lease profitable for both parties.

***The range of lease payments that make the lease profitable for both parties is the one that equals the cost of leasing with the cost of buying***. In other words, the value that makes the $\operatorname{NPV}$ and $\operatorname{NAL}$, zero. 

Then, if we have from the previous section that: 
$$
\begin{align*}
\operatorname{NPV}&= \$4,800,000\hspace{3pt} – \text{ Annual cash flow}\times \frac{1-\frac{1}{1.0632^4}}{0.0632}\\[10pt] 
0 &= \$4,800,000\hspace{3pt} – \text{ Annual cash flow}\times \frac{1-\frac{1}{1.0632^4}}{0.0632}\\[10pt] 
\end{align*}
$$ 
Then, 
$$
\begin{align*}
 \text{ Annual cash flow}&= \frac{\$4,800,000 }{\dfrac{1-\frac{1}{1.0632^4}}{0.0632}}\\[20pt]
 \text{ Annual cash flow}&=\frac{ \$4,800,000}{3.439865}\\[10pt] 
&= \$1,395,403.48
\end{align*}
$$

Let's check our result in the $\operatorname{NPV}$'s formula! $$ \begin{align*} \operatorname{NPV}&= \$4,800,000 \hspace{3pt}–\hspace{3pt} (\$1,447,346.18\times(1-0.21)+ \$252,000)\times\frac{1-\frac{1}{1.0632^4}}{0.0632}\\[10pt] &= \$4,800,000\hspace{3pt} –\hspace{3pt} \$1,395,403.48 \times3.439865\\[10pt] &= \$ 0 \end{align*} $$ $$ $$ ***The Lease payments that make the lease be profitable for both parties is $\bold{\$1,447,346.18}$***.
